definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: As a teenager, I went through a series of literary obsessions with different writers.
sentences.chinese: 少女时代的我，对一拨儿作家有过一连串文学迷恋。

definition: to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to enjoy watching a bustling scene/to go where the crowds are
outer (of cabbage etc)/upper (of a shoe)/(coll.) group/gang
to shout/to bawl/to yell (to urge on an animal)/to hawk (one's wares)/to denounce loudly/to shout slogans
to chatter idly/to gossip/to boast or brag
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
